content.question: The figure shows two nails made of a material of uniform density. The only difference between the shapes of the nails is the diameter of their heads, with the nail on the right having a larger head. The nails are held in the orientation shown. Let <math alttext="d sub L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>d</mi><mtext>L</mtext></msub></math> be the distance of the center of mass of the left nail from its head, and <math alttext="d sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>d</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub></math> be the distance of the center of mass of the right nail from its head. Which of the following correctly compares these lengths?

choices.label: <math alttext="d sub L is less than d sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>d</mi><mtext>L</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>d</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub></math>
<math alttext="d sub L is greater than d sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>d</mi><mtext>L</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>d</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub></math>
<math alttext="d sub L equals d sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>d</mi><mtext>L</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>d</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub></math>
It cannot be determined without knowing the exact ratio of the diameters of the nail heads.

content.answer: <math alttext="d sub L is greater than d sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>d</mi><mtext>L</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>d</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
